description: [Capital FM] Dakar, Senegal -- The Basketball Africa League (BAL) and the City of Dakar today unveiled a newly-renovated basketball court in Yoff, Senegal.
title: Africa: New Court Supports NBA Africa's Commitment to Build 1,000 Basketball Courts On the Continent Over the Next Decade

description: [Capital FM] Dakar, Senegal -- Anderson Correia got 16 points and five rebounds, Ivan Almeida added 14 points, 13 rebounds and eight assists and Basketball Africa League (BAL) debutant Kriol Star (Cape Verde) defeated the defending champion Petro de Luanda (Angola) 71-69 in overtime, booking their spot to the 2025 BAL Playoffs which will take place at SunBet Arena in Pretoria, South Africa from 6-14 June.
title: Africa: US Monastir, Petro De Luanda Kriol Star Advance to 2025 BAL Playoffs in South Africa

description: [Daily Trust] Seven-time African champions, the Flying Eagles of Nigeria and the Young Atlas Lions of Morocco played an evenly balanced goalless stalemate in a tightly contested Group B encounter at the 30 June Air Defence Stadium on Sunday, in what proved to be a physical and tactical battle during the U-20 Africa Cup of Nations.
title: Africa: U-20 Afcon - Nigeria Draw Goalless With Morocco

description: [Africom] Cairo, Egypt -- U.S. chaplain delegation led by U.S. Africa Command Chaplain Colonel Karen Meeker conducted collaborative meetings to bring stability through faith and new avenues of collaboration in support of the warfighter while in Cairo, Egypt, March 17, 2025.
title: Africa: Winning the Peace Through Religious Collaboration

description: [Global Fund] Geneva -- The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria (the Global Fund) has reached a historic milestone by procuring - for the first time - a first-line HIV treatment manufactured in Africa. The treatment - lifesaving, quality-assured antiretroviral medicines (ARVs) called TLD (tenofovir, lamivudine and dolutegravir), prequalified by the World Health Organization - was sourced from a leading Kenyan pharmaceutical company and delivered to Mozambique. The volume supplied can treat over 72,000 people per
title: Africa: In Historic First, the Global Fund Procures African-Made First-Line HIV Treatment

description: [Unicef] I grew up in this region. So when I took on the responsibility of UNICEF Regional Director a year ago, I did so with a deeper sense of purpose - and made a commitment--that it would be more than just a job.
title: Africa: Statement from UNICEF Regional Director, Gilles Fagninou, on Violence Against Children in West and Central Africa

description: [African Union] The African Union Commission (AUC) and the Intergovernmental Authority on Development (IGAD) jointly reaffirm their unwavering support to the Government and people of the Republic of South Sudan in their ongoing pursuit of peace, national unity, democratic governance, and sustainable development.
title: Africa: Joint Communiqué of the African Union Commission and IGAD On the Official Visit to the Republic of South Sudan

description: [Daily Trust] The Organisation of Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) has agreed to increase oil production for the second time in two months, adding 411,000 barrels per day to its production quota in June.
title: Africa: OPEC Approves Hike in Oil Production Despite Weak Prices

description: [Nigeria Health Watch] Gavi, the Vaccine Alliance has played a pivotal role in ensuring access to vaccines across low-income countries, especially in 40 African countries since 2000. This sustained contribution is one that not only deserves to be commended but also offers an example for other organisations to emulate, given the results it has yielded in over three decades.
title: Africa: Gavi Funding Cuts Could Be Africa's Moment of Reckoning for Vaccine Financing
Africa: All of Africa Today - May 6, 2025

description: [HRW] Advisory Opinion Could Further Cement Rights in Climate Action
title: Africa: Top African Rights Court to Consider States' Climate Obligations
Africa: Human Rights Watch Statement to the 83rd Ordinary Session of the African Commission On Human and Peoples' Rights

description: [IFJ] This year's report highlights an alarming scale of media freedom violations across various regions. These include incidents where journalists or media houses are attacked and instances where repressive policies, legislation, and practices are carried out to restrict media freedom.
title: Africa: NUSOJ Publishes Its Annual State of the Media Report

description: [Afropop] The excitement and anticipation was palpable as the seats began to fill in the historic Kings Theater on Flatbush Ave on Sunday, April 27th, 2025. When hype-man and percussionist Mbaye Dieye Faye led the twelve-piece band onstage, the capacity crowd jumped to our feet to welcome the legend himself: Youssou N'Dour strode out in a glistening white and blue kaftan, arms raised in his signature salute. The crowd poured into the aisles, phones held aloft in an attempt to capture, if it were possible, the
title: Africa: Youssou N'dour At Brooklyn's King's Theater

description: [Afropop] Once again, Afropop Worldwide is thrilled to partner with the New York African Film Festival, one of the most extensive festivals of its kind in the world.
title: Africa: Afropop Worldwide Co-Presents Two Films With the African Film Festival

description: [The Conversation Africa] Africa faces challenges in reducing extreme poverty and inequality. In 2024, 8.5% of the global population was living in extreme poverty (that is, on less than US$2.15 a day). Nearly 67% of these people were living in sub-Saharan Africa.
title: Africa: Investing in Agriculture Reduces Poverty and Inequality - Economic Model Finds the Best Funding Mix for 10 African Countries

description: [UN News] Greater awareness and action are needed as Europe and parts of the Middle East grapple with fresh outbreaks of foot-and-mouth disease (FMD) which can have devastating impacts on both animal health and regional economies, the UN Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) warned on Monday.
title: Africa: FAO Calls for Action Amid Foot-and-Mouth Disease Outbreaks

description: [IPS] Bratislava -- Global press freedom across the world is at a "critical moment," campaigners have warned, as a major index mapping the state of global press freedom hits an unprecedented low.
title: Africa: World Press Freedom Day 2025 - Global Press Freedom Index Falls to Critical Low
